p(int, int) - Method in class PascalRecursive.PascalPanel
Determines the next row by returning the integer above, and adding it to the interger above and to the left one space.
paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class BinomialTheorem.PascalPanel
Using two nested loops, the specified position of the number in Pascal's triangle is determined by adding the number directly above, and directly above to the left.

Using a method p, the next row is determines by returning the integer directly above, and directly above and to the left one space.
PascalIterative - Class in <Unnamed>
Purpose: Develop the PascalIterative class that will be utilized to display the first 20 rows of the Pascal triangle.
PascalIterative() - Constructor for class PascalIterative
 
PascalIterative.PascalPanel - Class in <Unnamed>
Purpose: Using an iterative approach, develop the PascalPanel that will paint and calculate the number of rows of Pascal's triangle, specified by the user through a JOptionPane.
PascalIterative.PascalPanel() - Constructor for class PascalIterative.PascalPanel
Sets up the properties of the panel such as background colour, width, height, and the input of the user used for the number of rows to be displayed.
PascalRecursive - Class in <Unnamed>
Purpose: Through recursion, the PascalIterative class will be utilized to display the first 20 rows of the Pascal triangle.
PascalRecursive() - Constructor for class PascalRecursive
 
PascalRecursive.PascalPanel - Class in <Unnamed>
Purpose: Using a recursive approach, develop the PascalPanel that will paint and calculate the number of rows of Pascal's triangle, specified by the user through a JOptionPane.
PascalRecursive.PascalPanel() - Constructor for class PascalRecursive.PascalPanel
Sets up the properties of the panel such as background colour, width, height, and the input of the user used for the number of rows to be displayed.
